title: Fermented Foods
description: Test your knowledge of fermented foods from around the world!

questions.question: What is the fermented cabbage dish that is a staple of Korean cuisine?
questions.explanation: Kimchi is a traditional Korean side dish made from salted and fermented vegetables, most commonly napa cabbage and Korean radishes.

questions.question: Which fermented milk drink originated in the Caucasus Mountains?
questions.explanation: Kefir originated in the Caucasus Mountains and is made by adding kefir grains to milk, producing a tangy, probiotic-rich drink.

questions.question: What Japanese seasoning paste is made from fermented soybeans?
questions.explanation: Miso is a traditional Japanese seasoning made by fermenting soybeans with salt and a fungus called koji. It is commonly used in soups and sauces.

questions.question: Sauerkraut, a fermented cabbage dish, is most closely associated with which country?
questions.explanation: Sauerkraut is strongly associated with German cuisine, though fermented cabbage dishes exist in many European cultures.

questions.question: What type of fermentation is used to make yogurt?
questions.explanation: Yogurt is produced through lactic acid fermentation, where bacteria convert lactose (milk sugar) into lactic acid, thickening the milk and giving it a tangy flavor.

questions.question: Tempeh, a popular plant-based protein, is made from fermented what?
questions.explanation: Tempeh is made from fermented soybeans bound together by a white mycelium. It originated in Indonesia and is a staple protein source.

questions.question: What is kombucha?
questions.explanation: Kombucha is a fermented tea drink made using a symbiotic culture of bacteria and yeast (SCOBY). It has been consumed for centuries in East Asia.

questions.question: Which of these cheeses relies heavily on fermentation by mold?
questions.explanation: Roquefort is a blue cheese made with Penicillium roqueforti mold, which creates the distinctive blue-green veins and sharp, tangy flavor.

questions.question: What is the main beneficial component found in fermented foods?
questions.explanation: Fermented foods are rich in probiotics, which are live beneficial bacteria that support gut health and the immune system.

questions.question: Natto, a traditional Japanese food with a strong smell, is made from fermented what?
questions.explanation: Natto is made from soybeans fermented with Bacillus subtilis bacteria. It has a strong flavor, sticky texture, and is rich in vitamin K2.

questions.question: What fermented condiment is essential in Worcestershire sauce?
questions.explanation: Worcestershire sauce contains fermented anchovies as a key ingredient, along with vinegar, molasses, and various spices. The fermentation process takes months.

questions.question: Which country is the birthplace of the fermented soybean paste called doenjang?
questions.explanation: Doenjang is a traditional Korean fermented soybean paste that has been a staple of Korean cooking for centuries. It is similar to but distinct from Japanese miso.

questions.question: What is the process of making sourdough bread dependent on?
options: Wild yeast and lactic acid bacteria
questions.explanation: Sourdough bread uses a starter culture of wild yeast and lactic acid bacteria to leaven the dough, giving it a distinctive tangy flavor and chewy texture.

questions.question: Which fermented beverage was historically important for sailors to prevent scurvy?
questions.explanation: Captain James Cook brought barrels of sauerkraut on his voyages. The fermented cabbage retained its vitamin C content, helping prevent scurvy among sailors.

questions.question: What is the traditional Ethiopian fermented flatbread called?
questions.explanation: Injera is a spongy, sour flatbread made from fermented teff flour. It serves as both a plate and utensil in Ethiopian cuisine.
